    <h1 class="bg-red-400">Installation Tailwind</h1>
    <a href="https://nodejs.org/en" target="_blank">Nods js Install</a>
     <br />
    <a href="https://tailwindcss.com/docs/installation" target="_blank">Tailwind CSS Installation command </a>
    <h2>Tailwaid Installation Steps</h2>
    <p>1. Install node.js</p>
    <p>2. run command in vs code for checking installation : node -v</p>
    <p>3. for creating package.json file run : npm init</p>
    <p>press Enter Enter .....</p>
    <p>4. npm install -D tailwindcss</p>
    <p>5. npx tailwindcss init</p>
    <h2 class="bg-red-500">Create two folder name dist and src</h2>
    <p>under dist create two file name like index.html and tailstyle.css</p>
    <p>under src create file name like input.css</p>
    <p>Paste the below command in input.css</p>
    @tailwind base; 
    @tailwind components; 
    @tailwind utilities;
    <p>modify the tailwind.config.js file</p>
    /** @type {import('tailwindcss').Config} */ module.exports = { content:
    ["./dist/*.{html,js}"], theme: { extend: {}, }, plugins: [], }

    <p>
      run command : 
      npx tailwindcss -i ./src/input.css -o ./dist/style.css      --watch
    </p>
    <p>
      where src/input is default file for tailwind and dist/tailstyle.css output
      file
    </p>

    <code>npx tailwindcss -i ./src/input.css -o ./dist/output.css --watch</code>

    <h2 class="bg-red-600">
      The above code run every time for new project then we can put package.json
      file
    </h2>
    <p>before</p>
    <p>"scripts": { "test": "echo \"Error: no test specified\" && exit 1" },</p>
    <p>after</p>
    <p>
      "scripts": { "test": "echo \"Error: no test specified\" && exit 1", "div":
      "tailwindcss -i ./src/input.css -o ./dist/tailstyle.css --watch" },
    </p>
    <p>now we can run command : npm run div</p>

    <h2>Troubleshooting</h2>
    <!-- run watch -->
npm run div 
<!-- Push to remote repo -->
git push --force https://github.com/ramjeeindia/Tailwind.git



Delete that repo and create a new one and try the following commands again:

cd 'Local Directory Path'
git remote add origin *your_git_name.git*
git push -u origin master
if add origin shows already exists use this instead:

git remote set-url origin *https://github.com/ramjeeindia/Tailwind*
